Style.Data: #Parameters is a set of custom functions for serializing name-value pair (dictionary) data in Let Notation, such as for passing multiple parameters to a script. (If you aren't familiar with Let Notation, it basically looks like the variable-setting part of a call to FileMaker's Let function.) To install #Parameters in your FileMaker file, simply import all the custom functions starting with "#" from this file (plus the ScriptOptionalParameterList, ScriptRequiredParameterList, and VerifyVariablesNotEmpty functions) and copy the "#Parameters" module script folder into your file's "Modules" script folder.

#Parameters is a set of custom functions for serializing name-value pair (dictionary) data in Let Notation, such as for passing multiple parameters to a script. (If you aren't familiar with Let Notation, it basically looks like the variable-setting part of a call to FileMaker's Let function.) To install #Parameters in your FileMaker file, simply import all the custom functions starting with "#" from this file (plus the ScriptOptionalParameterList, ScriptRequiredParameterList, and VerifyVariablesNotEmpty functions) and copy the "#Parameters" module script folder into your file's "Modules" script folder.
Developed by the contributors to FileMakerStandards.org.
Developed by the contributors to FileMakerStandards.org.

Step.name: Perform Script
Step.StepText: Perform Script [ “Open FileMakerStandards.org Let Notation Best Practices” ]

Script.name: Open FileMakerStandards.org Let Notation Best Practices

Style.Data: The # ( name ; value ) function creates a name-value pair. A dictionary data structure can be created by concatenating several calls to #() as if they were plain text. Name-value pairs can be nested.
The # ( name ; value ) function creates a name-value pair. A dictionary data structure can be created by concatenating several calls to #() as if they were plain text. Name-value pairs can be nested.

Named values can be over-written or effectively erased by concatenating a call to #() to the end of a dictionary using the same name and a different value. This works because the #Get and #Assign functions will always respect the
instance of a named value in a dictionary.

Named values can be over-written or effectively erased by concatenating a call to #() to the end of a dictionary using the same name and a different value. This works because the #Get and #Assign functions will always respect the last instance of a named value in a dictionary.

This last-value-wins behavior can also be used to set default values for optional parameters. By placing the defaults before the actual parameters, any values set by the actual script parameter will override the defaults.

This last-value-wins behavior can also be used to set default values for optional parameters. By placing the defaults before the actual parameters, any values set by the actual script parameter will override the defaults.

The #Assign function parses a dictionary into locally-scoped script variables. The name from each name-value pair is used as the variable name, and the value from each pair is used as that variable's value.

The #Assign function parses a dictionary into locally-scoped script variables. The name from each name-value pair is used as the variable name, and the value from each pair is used as that variable's value.

The #Assign function returns True (1) if there was no error detected while assigning the values to variables, and returns False (0) otherwise. If there was an error detected, FileMaker's error code is assigned to the $#Assign.error variable.

The #Assign function returns True (1) if there was no error detected while assigning the values to variables, and returns False (0) otherwise. If there was an error detected, FileMaker's error code is assigned to the $#Assign.error variable.

The #Get function returns a named value from a dictionary. Unlike the #Assign function, #Get will not modify any variables. This can be useful when a value only needs to be used in one calculation, or to assign a value to a variable with a different name.

The #Get function returns a named value from a dictionary. Unlike the #Assign function, #Get will not modify any variables. This can be useful when a value only needs to be used in one calculation, or to assign a value to a variable with a different name.
The #AssignGlobal function parses a dictionary into global variables instead of local variables.
The #AssignGlobal function parses a dictionary into global variables instead of local variables.

The #AssignGlobal function returns True (1) if there was no error detected while assigning the values to variables, and returns False (0) otherwise. If there was an error detected, FileMaker's error code is assigned to the $#AssignGlobal.error variable.

The #AssignGlobal function returns True (1) if there was no error detected while assigning the values to variables, and returns False (0) otherwise. If there was an error detected, FileMaker's error code is assigned to the $#AssignGlobal.error variable.

The #Filter function returns a dictionary containing only those name-value pairs where the name is included in the return-delimited list filterParameters. This function can prevent an "injection" of unexpected variables that might cause problems.

The #Filter function returns a dictionary containing only those name-value pairs where the name is included in the return-delimited list filterParameters. This function can prevent an "injection" of unexpected variables that might cause problems.

#Assign ( #Filter ( # ( "name" ; "value" ) & # ( "otherName" ; "otherValue" ) & # ( "foo" ; "bar" ) ; List ( "name" ; "otherName" ) ) ) // $name and $other name are assigned // "value" and "otherValue", respectively; // $foo is unaffected

#Assign ( #Filter ( # ( "name" ; "value" ) & # ( "otherName" ; "otherValue" ) & # ( "foo" ; "bar" ) ; List ( "name" ; "otherName" ) ) ) // $name and $other name are assigned // "value" and "otherValue", respectively; // $foo is unaffected

The #GetNameList function returns a list of names from all name/value pairs in parameters. This is useful when you don't know what names exist, and you want to iterate through all the name/value pairs in a dictionary.

The #GetNameList function returns a list of names from all name/value pairs in parameters. This is useful when you don't know what names exist, and you want to iterate through all the name/value pairs in a dictionary.

The #Remove function returns a dictionary containing only those name-value pairs where the name is not included in the return-delimited list removeParameters. This is complementary to the #Filter function.

The #Remove function returns a dictionary containing only those name-value pairs where the name is not included in the return-delimited list removeParameters. This is complementary to the #Filter function.

#Assign ( #Remove ( # ( "name" ; "value" ) & # ( "otherName" ; "otherValue" ) & # ( "foo" ; "bar" ) ; List ( "name" ; "otherName" ) ) ) // $foo is assigned "bar"; // $name and $otherName are unaffected

#Assign ( #Remove ( # ( "name" ; "value" ) & # ( "otherName" ; "otherValue" ) & # ( "foo" ; "bar" ) ; List ( "name" ; "otherName" ) ) ) // $foo is assigned "bar"; // $name and $otherName are unaffected

The ScriptOptionalParameterList function parses a script name, returning a return-delimited list of optional parameters for that script, in the order they appear in the script name. This function assumes that the script name conforms to the FileMakerStandards.org naming convention for scripts.

The ScriptOptionalParameterList function parses a script name, returning a return-delimited list of optional parameters for that script, in the order they appear in the script name. This function assumes that the script name conforms to the FileMakerStandards.org naming convention for scripts.
This is useful to generate the argument used by the #Filter function to restrict variable assignment to parameters actually accepted by a script.
This is useful to generate the argument used by the #Filter function to restrict variable assignment to parameters actually accepted by a script.
When the scriptNameToParse parameter is empty, the function will use the current script name.
When the scriptNameToParse parameter is empty, the function will use the current script name.

The ScriptRequiredParameterList function parses a script name, returning a return-delimited list of parameters required for that script, in the order they appear in the script name. This function assumes that the script name conforms to the FileMakerStandards.org naming convention for scripts. This is useful to generate the argument used by the VerifyVariablesNotEmpty function to validate that all required parameters have values. When the scriptNameToParse parameter is empty, the function will use the current script name.

The ScriptRequiredParameterList function parses a script name, returning a return-delimited list of parameters required for that script, in the order they appear in the script name. This function assumes that the script name conforms to the FileMakerStandards.org naming convention for scripts. This is useful to generate the argument used by the VerifyVariablesNotEmpty function to validate that all required parameters have values. When the scriptNameToParse parameter is empty, the function will use the current script name.
ScriptRequiredParameterList ( "Script Name ( required1 ; required2 ; { optional1 } )" ) // = List ( "required1" ; "required2" )
ScriptRequiredParameterList ( "Script Name ( required1 ; required2 ; { optional1 } )" ) // = List ( "required1" ; "required2" )

The VerifyVariablesNotEmpty function checks whether or not a series of locally-scoped script variables have non-empty values. This is designed to work best in combination with the ScriptRequiredParameterList function to provide the list of values can check. This way a script can easily validate that it has received and parsed all it's required parameters.

The VerifyVariablesNotEmpty function checks whether or not a series of locally-scoped script variables have non-empty values. This is designed to work best in combination with the ScriptRequiredParameterList function to provide the list of values can check. This way a script can easily validate that it has received and parsed all it's required parameters.
VerifyVariablesNotEmpty ( ScriptRequiredParameterList ( "" ) ) // False (0) if any required parameters // are empty. True (1) otherwise.
VerifyVariablesNotEmpty ( ScriptRequiredParameterList ( "" ) ) // False (0) if any required parameters // are empty. True (1) otherwise.

This is a new function we're trying out, but we haven't necessarily accepted as a "best practice" approach. Let us know what you think! The #Array function is syntactic sugar for creating arrays of repeating variables in Let notation.

This is a new function we're trying out, but we haven't necessarily accepted as a "best practice" approach. Let us know what you think! The #Array function is syntactic sugar for creating arrays of repeating variables in Let notation.
Note that with the #Array functions, it is syntactically valid to leave the name empty, unlike the # ( name ; value ) function.
Note that with the #Array functions, it is syntactically valid to leave the name empty, unlike the # ( name ; value ) function.

This is a new function we're trying out, but we haven't necessarily accepted as a "best practice" approach. Let us know what you think! The #ArrayFromList function turns a return-delimited list into a repeating variable array in Let notation.

This is a new function we're trying out, but we haven't necessarily accepted as a "best practice" approach. Let us know what you think! The #ArrayFromList function turns a return-delimited list into a repeating variable array in Let notation.

This is a new function we're trying out, but we haven't necessarily accepted as a "best practice" approach. Let us know what you think! The #ArrayGet function is syntactic sugar for retrieving data from arrays of repeating variables in Let notation.

This is a new function we're trying out, but we haven't necessarily accepted as a "best practice" approach. Let us know what you think! The #ArrayGet function is syntactic sugar for retrieving data from arrays of repeating variables in Let notation.

This is a new function we're trying out, but we haven't necessarily accepted as a "best practice" approach. Let us know what you think! The #List function encodes a value in a manner that preserves the data type and escapes all returns/new lines, then appends a trailing return.

This is a new function we're trying out, but we haven't necessarily accepted as a "best practice" approach. Let us know what you think! The #List function encodes a value in a manner that preserves the data type and escapes all returns/new lines, then appends a trailing return.

This is a new function we're trying out, but we haven't necessarily accepted as a "best practice" approach. Let us know what you think! The #ListGet function retrieves a value from a list created with the #List function. It preserves the data type and all special characters from the original value.

This is a new function we're trying out, but we haven't necessarily accepted as a "best practice" approach. Let us know what you think! The #ListGet function retrieves a value from a list created with the #List function. It preserves the data type and all special characters from the original value.

This function is deprecated. It is documented here for historical reference. Please use other functions in new development work. The #AssignScriptParameters function will assign all named values in the script parameter to local script variables of the same name. If any parameters indicated as required by the script name are empty, the function returns False (0); the function returns True (1) otherwise.

This function is deprecated. It is documented here for historical reference. Please use other functions in new development work. The #AssignScriptParameters function will assign all named values in the script parameter to local script variables of the same name. If any parameters indicated as required by the script name are empty, the function returns False (0); the function returns True (1) otherwise.

A combination of the #Assign, VariablesNotEmpty, and ScriptRequiredParameterList functions is the preferred way to replicate this behavior. This approach enables greater flexibility in defining what variables are required and how those variables are assigned.

A combination of the #Assign, VariablesNotEmpty, and ScriptRequiredParameterList functions is the preferred way to replicate this behavior. This approach enables greater flexibility in defining what variables are required and how those variables are assigned.
Set Variable [$!; Value:#Assign ( Get ( ScriptParameter ) )] If [not VerifyVariablesNotEmpty ( ScriptRequiredParameterList ( "" ) )] Exit Script [Result:# ( "error" ; 10 )] End If
Set Variable [$!; Value:#Assign ( Get ( ScriptParameter ) )] If [not VerifyVariablesNotEmpty ( ScriptRequiredParameterList ( "" ) )] Exit Script [Result:# ( "error" ; 10 )] End If

The functions in this module were developed using strict test-driven development methods. For #Parameters, the tests do not just confirm that the functions work, they define what it means for the functions to work correctly. It takes more work, but we use these functions so much that we think it's worth the extra effort to be confident that they work well. If you wish to modify or extend the module yourself, please follow the same protocol for each new behavior you add or change: 1. Write one test case. 2. Confirm that the test fails. 3. Write only enough code to pass the test. 4. Confirm that all tests pass. You can look at the test scripts in this file for examples to follow.

Step.name: Set Variable
Step.StepText: Set Variable [ $windowHeight; Value:Let ( [ ~target = $targetContentHeight * Get ( WindowZoomLevel ) / 100 ; ~current = Get ( WindowContentHeight ) ; ~difference = ~target - ~current ] ; Get ( WindowHeight ) + ~difference ) ]

Step.name: Move/Resize Window
Step.StepText: Move/Resize Window [ Current Window; Height: $windowHeight; Width: $windowWidth; Top: ( Get ( WindowDesktopHeight ) - $windowHeight ) / 2; Left: ( Get ( WindowDesktopWidth ) - $windowWidth ) / 2 ]

Step.name: Set Variable
Step.StepText: Set Variable [ $testFolderPath; Value:/* File Folder/Tests/<ISO timestamp>/ */ Let ( [ ~filePath = If ( Get ( ConnectionState ) = 0; // if file is not hosted Get ( FilePath ); /* Else */ Get ( DesktopPath ) ); ~filePath = // convert slash- to return-delimited Substitute ( ~filePath; [ "file:" ; "" ]; [ "/" ; ¶ ] ); ~filePath = // strip file name from the path LeftValues ( ~filePath ; ValueCount ( ~filePath ) - 1 ); ~filePath = // convert back to slash-delimited Substitute ( ~filePath ; ¶ ; "/" ); ~now = // file name-friendly timestamp Substitute ( ISOFromTimestamp ( Get ( CurrentTimeStamp ) ); [ "-" ; "" ]; [ " " ; "_" ]; [ ":" ; "" ] ) ]; ~filePath & "Tests/" & ~now & "/" ) ]

Value.Calculation: /* File Folder/Tests/<ISO timestamp>/ */ Let ( [ ~filePath = If ( Get ( ConnectionState ) = 0; // if file is not hosted Get ( FilePath ); /* Else */ Get ( DesktopPath ) ); ~filePath = // convert slash- to return-delimited Substitute ( ~filePath; [ "file:" ; "" ]; [ "/" ; ¶ ] ); ~filePath = // strip file name from the path LeftValues ( ~filePath ; ValueCount ( ~filePath ) - 1 ); ~filePath = // convert back to slash-delimited Substitute ( ~filePath ; ¶ ; "/" ); ~now = // file name-friendly timestamp Substitute ( ISOFromTimestamp ( Get ( CurrentTimeStamp ) ); [ "-" ; "" ]; [ " " ; "_" ]; [ ":" ; "" ] ) ]; ~filePath & "Tests/" & ~now & "/" )

DisplayCalculation.Chunk: // strip file name from the path

Step.Name: $testFolderPath

Step.StepText: # Guarantee that destination folder for any target tests exists
Step.Text: Guarantee that destination folder for any target tests exists

Step.name: Perform AppleScript
Step.StepText: Perform AppleScript [ Calculated AppleScript: Let ( [ ~shellScript = "mkdir -p 'volumes/" & $testFolderPath & "'"; ~appleScript = "do shell script " & Quote ( ~shellScript ) ]; ~appleScript ) ]

Step.name: Comment
Step.StepText: # Create list of folders in path to attempt to create
Step.Text: Create list of folders in path to attempt to create

Step.name: Set Variable
Step.StepText: Set Variable [ $folderList; Value:/* Return-delimited list of folders in testFolderPath */ Substitute ( "<<START>>" & $testFolderPath; [ "<<START>>/" ; "" ]; [ "<<START>>" ; "" ]; [ "file:/" ; "" ]; [ "/" ; ¶ ] ) ]

Value.Calculation: /* Return-delimited list of folders in testFolderPath */ Substitute ( "<<START>>" & $testFolderPath; [ "<<START>>/" ; "" ]; [ "<<START>>" ; "" ]; [ "file:/" ; "" ]; [ "/" ; ¶ ] )

DisplayCalculation.Chunk: /* Return-delimited list of folders in testFolderPath */

Step.Name: $folderList

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.StepText: Exit Loop If [ /* For $i from 1 to $folderCount */ Let ( $i = $i + 1 ; $i > $folderCount ) ]

Step.name: Send Event
Step.StepText: Send Event [ open document/application; "cmd /c md \"" & Substitute ( $newFolderList ; ¶ ; "\" \"" ) & "\"" // cmd /c md "FILEDIRECTORY\Tests" "FILEDIRECTORY\Tests\20120916_120554" ]

Step.StepText: Set Variable [ $path; Value:$testFolderPath & ScriptID ( "" ; $scriptName ) & " - " & Substitute ( $scriptName ; ":" ; "-" ) & ".tap" // Test Anything Protocol ]

Step.name: Perform Script
Step.StepText: Perform Script [ “Export Text File ( path ; content )”; Parameter: # ( "path" ; $path ) & # ( "content" ; $testLog ) ]

Step.name: Show Custom Dialog
Step.StepText: Show Custom Dialog [ Title: Get ( ScriptName ); Message: "Testing complete.¶Pass ratio: " & $passRatioNumerator & " / " & $passRatioDenominator & " (" & Round ( 100 * $passRatioNumerator / $passRatioDenominator ; 0 ) & "%)" & If ( $export ; "¶Test results were be exported to:¶¶" & $testFolderPath ); Default Button: “OK”, Commit: “Yes” ]

Message.Calculation: "Testing complete.¶Pass ratio: " & $passRatioNumerator & " / " & $passRatioDenominator & " (" & Round ( 100 * $passRatioNumerator / $passRatioDenominator ; 0 ) & "%)" & If ( $export ; "¶Test results were be exported to:¶¶" & $testFolderPath )

Modified on 2012-12-13 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> to keep a running tally of the pass ratio. Modified on 2012-10-24 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> to export test files to either a "Tests" folder in the same directory as the file (default for non-hosted files), a "Tests" folder on the desktop (default for hosted files) or a folder specified by script parameter. Modified on 2012-10-24 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> to call each test script, and to accept script name results from each test script. Created on 2012-09-15 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante>.

Modified on 2012-12-13 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> to keep a running tally of the pass ratio. Modified on 2012-10-24 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> to export test files to either a "Tests" folder in the same directory as the file (default for non-hosted files), a "Tests" folder on the desktop (default for hosted files) or a folder specified by script parameter. Modified on 2012-10-24 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> to call each test script, and to accept script name results from each test script. Created on 2012-09-15 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante>.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Prompt user for result preferences

Step.name: Show Custom Dialog
Step.StepText: Show Custom Dialog [ Title: Get ( ScriptName ); Message: "Would you like to export results of each test to a .tap (plain text) file?"; Default Button: “Export”, Commit: “No”; Button 2: “Don't”, Commit: “No”; Button 3: “Cancel”, Commit: “No” ]

Message.Calculation: "Would you like to export results of each test to a .tap (plain text) file?"

DisplayCalculation.Chunk: "Would you like to export results of each test to a .tap (plain text) file?"

Step.name: Exit Script
Step.StepText: Exit Script [ Result: # ( "error" ; 1 ) // User canceled action ]

Step.name: Show Custom Dialog
Step.StepText: Show Custom Dialog [ Title: Get ( ScriptName ); Message: "Would you like to show or hide dialogs with results for each test?¶Click \"Failures\" to only show results for tests where some results are \"not ok.\"¶Click \"All\" to show results for all tests regardless of results.¶Click \"Hide\" to only show a final dialog after all tests have run."; Default Button: “Failures”, Commit: “No”; Button 2: “All”, Commit: “No”; Button 3: “Hide”, Commit: “No” ]

Message.Calculation: "Would you like to show or hide dialogs with results for each test?¶Click \"Failures\" to only show results for tests where some results are \"not ok.\"¶Click \"All\" to show results for all tests regardless of results.¶Click \"Hide\" to only show a final dialog after all tests have run."

DisplayCalculation.Chunk: "Would you like to show or hide dialogs with results for each test?¶Click \"Failures\" to only show results for tests where some results are \"not ok.\"¶Click \"All\" to show results for all tests regardless of results.¶Click \"Hide\" to only show a final dialog after all tests have run."

Step.name: Set Variable
Step.StepText: Set Variable [ $testFolderPath; Value:/* File Folder/Tests/<ISO timestamp>/ */ Let ( [ ~filePath = If ( Get ( ConnectionState ) = 0; // if file is not hosted Get ( FilePath ); /* Else */ Get ( DesktopPath ) ); ~filePath = // convert slash- to return-delimited Substitute ( ~filePath; [ "file:" ; "" ]; [ "/" ; ¶ ] ); ~filePath = // strip file name from the path LeftValues ( ~filePath ; ValueCount ( ~filePath ) - 1 ); ~filePath = // convert back to slash-delimited Substitute ( ~filePath ; ¶ ; "/" ); ~now = // file name-friendly timestamp Substitute ( ISOFromTimestamp ( Get ( CurrentTimeStamp ) ); [ "-" ; "" ]; [ " " ; "_" ]; [ ":" ; "" ] ) ]; ~filePath & "Tests/" & ~now & "/" ) ]

Value.Calculation: /* File Folder/Tests/<ISO timestamp>/ */ Let ( [ ~filePath = If ( Get ( ConnectionState ) = 0; // if file is not hosted Get ( FilePath ); /* Else */ Get ( DesktopPath ) ); ~filePath = // convert slash- to return-delimited Substitute ( ~filePath; [ "file:" ; "" ]; [ "/" ; ¶ ] ); ~filePath = // strip file name from the path LeftValues ( ~filePath ; ValueCount ( ~filePath ) - 1 ); ~filePath = // convert back to slash-delimited Substitute ( ~filePath ; ¶ ; "/" ); ~now = // file name-friendly timestamp Substitute ( ISOFromTimestamp ( Get ( CurrentTimeStamp ) ); [ "-" ; "" ]; [ " " ; "_" ]; [ ":" ; "" ] ) ]; ~filePath & "Tests/" & ~now & "/" )

DisplayCalculation.Chunk: // strip file name from the path

Step.Name: $testFolderPath

Step.name: Comment
Step.StepText: # Guarantee that destination folder for any target tests exists
Step.Text: Guarantee that destination folder for any target tests exists

Step.name: Perform AppleScript
Step.StepText: Perform AppleScript [ Calculated AppleScript: Let ( [ ~shellScript = "mkdir -p 'volumes/" & $testFolderPath & "'"; ~appleScript = "do shell script " & Quote ( ~shellScript ) ]; ~appleScript ) ]

Step.name: Comment
Step.StepText: # Create list of folders in path to attempt to create
Step.Text: Create list of folders in path to attempt to create

Step.name: Set Variable
Step.StepText: Set Variable [ $folderList; Value:/* Return-delimited list of folders in testFolderPath */ Substitute ( "<<START>>" & $testFolderPath; [ "<<START>>/" ; "" ]; [ "<<START>>" ; "" ]; [ "file:/" ; "" ]; [ "/" ; ¶ ] ) ]

Value.Calculation: /* Return-delimited list of folders in testFolderPath */ Substitute ( "<<START>>" & $testFolderPath; [ "<<START>>/" ; "" ]; [ "<<START>>" ; "" ]; [ "file:/" ; "" ]; [ "/" ; ¶ ] )

DisplayCalculation.Chunk: /* Return-delimited list of folders in testFolderPath */

Step.Name: $folderList

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.StepText: Exit Loop If [ /* For $i from 1 to $folderCount */ Let ( $i = $i + 1 ; $i > $folderCount ) ]

Step.name: Send Event
Step.StepText: Send Event [ open document/application; "cmd /c md \"" & Substitute ( $newFolderList ; ¶ ; "\" \"" ) & "\"" // cmd /c md "FILEDIRECTORY\Tests" "FILEDIRECTORY\Tests\20120916_120554" ]

Step.name: Comment
Step.StepText: # Pause for a moment to allow OS to create folders; timing may need to be adjusted
Step.Text: Pause for a moment to allow OS to create folders; timing may need to be adjusted

Step.name: Set Variable
Step.StepText: Set Variable [ $path; Value:$testFolderPath & ScriptID ( "" ; $scriptName ) & " - " & Substitute ( $scriptName ; ":" ; "-" ) & ".tap" // Test Anything Protocol ]
Step.Name: $path

Step.name: Perform Script
Step.StepText: Perform Script [ “Export Text File ( path ; content )”; Parameter: #( "path" ; $path ) & # ( "content" ; $testLog ) ]

Step.name: Show Custom Dialog
Step.StepText: Show Custom Dialog [ Title: $scriptName; Message: $testLog; Default Button: “OK”, Commit: “Yes” ]

Step.name: Show Custom Dialog
Step.StepText: Show Custom Dialog [ Title: Get ( ScriptName ); Message: "Testing complete.¶Pass ratio: " & $passRatioNumerator & " / " & $passRatioDenominator & " (" & Round ( 100 * $passRatioNumerator / $passRatioDenominator ; 0 ) & "%)" & If ( $export ; "¶Test results were be exported to:¶¶" & $testFolderPath ); Default Button: “OK”, Commit: “Yes” ]

Message.Calculation: "Testing complete.¶Pass ratio: " & $passRatioNumerator & " / " & $passRatioDenominator & " (" & Round ( 100 * $passRatioNumerator / $passRatioDenominator ; 0 ) & "%)" & If ( $export ; "¶Test results were be exported to:¶¶" & $testFolderPath )

Step.name: Comment
Step.StepText: # Modified on 2014-10-07 by Daniel Smith dansmith65@gmail.com - for all tests: evaluate in a Let statement and test for EvaluationError = 0 - for all tests: add evaluateErrorActual - don't use # function to encode parameter sent to Generate Sample Name script Modified on 2014-06-06 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> - Adding test for type detection in long digit sequences Modified on 2014-05-25 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> - Checking that strings of digits with invalid date separators are not interpreted as dates Modified on 2013-12-23 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante>. - Guarantee that sample names do not contain carriage returns. - Expanding character space for names to include spaces (Char ( 32 )). - Randomly insert newline characters (except carriage returns) in names. - Delegate generation of names to a subscript. - Simplifying whitespace character test Modified on 2013-12-17 by John Jones <john.christopher@alumni.virginia.edu> to test for escaping LF in the value. Modified on 2013-09-03 by Daniel Smith dansmith65@gmail.com to test for whitespace as the value Modified on 2013-07-26 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> to test for certain type detection bugs confusing dates and times with numbers. Modified on 2013-04-15 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> to not wrap numbers in GetAsNumber. Modified on 2013-01-14 by Daniel Smith dansmith65@gmail.com - rename tests - expect a trailing return when an error occurs - add tests: "Valid value: ?", "Valid name: numbers only" - modify test to not loop: "Valid value: empty" Modified on 2012-12-17 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> to exclude characters below 33 from test names. Modified on 2012-12-13 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> to return the passRatio result. Modified on 2012-12-12 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante>. - Modified tests to include larger ranges of possible values. - Modified looping tests to run to a maximum time rather than number of iterations. Modified on 2012-12-12 by Daniel Smith dansmith65@gmail.com - added tests for a version of the function that will preserve data type - add $minCharCode and $maxCharCode variables to limit the character set used for generating test data Created on 2012-11-10 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante>.
Step.Text: Modified on 2014-10-07 by Daniel Smith dansmith65@gmail.com - for all tests: evaluate in a Let statement and test for EvaluationError = 0 - for all tests: add evaluateErrorActual - don't use # function to encode parameter sent to Generate Sample Name script Modified on 2014-06-06 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> - Adding test for type detection in long digit sequences Modified on 2014-05-25 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> - Checking that strings of digits with invalid date separators are not interpreted as dates Modified on 2013-12-23 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante>. - Guarantee that sample names do not contain carriage returns. - Expanding character space for names to include spaces (Char ( 32 )). - Randomly insert newline characters (except carriage returns) in names. - Delegate generation of names to a subscript. - Simplifying whitespace character test Modified on 2013-12-17 by John Jones <john.christopher@alumni.virginia.edu> to test for escaping LF in the value. Modified on 2013-09-03 by Daniel Smith dansmith65@gmail.com to test for whitespace as the value Modified on 2013-07-26 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> to test for certain type detection bugs confusing dates and times with numbers. Modified on 2013-04-15 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> to not wrap numbers in GetAsNumber. Modified on 2013-01-14 by Daniel Smith dansmith65@gmail.com - rename tests - expect a trailing return when an error occurs - add tests: "Valid value: ?", "Valid name: numbers only" - modify test to not loop: "Valid value: empty" Modified on 2012-12-17 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> to exclude characters below 33 from test names. Modified on 2012-12-13 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> to return the passRatio result. Modified on 2012-12-12 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante>. - Modified tests to include larger ranges of possible values. - Modified looping tests to run to a maximum time rather than number of iterations. Modified on 2012-12-12 by Daniel Smith dansmith65@gmail.com - added tests for a version of the function that will preserve data type - add $minCharCode and $maxCharCode variables to limit the character set used for generating test data Created on 2012-11-10 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante>.

Step.StepText: # Modified on 2013-12-24 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante>. - Removing dependence on the ValueShuffleMerge function, which doesn't correctly process dictionaries containing newline characters other than carriage returns. Modified on 2013-01-08 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> to test that #Get handles erroneous $ prefixes in the name parameter the same way the # ( name ; value ) function does. Created on 2012-12-05 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante>.

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.StepText: Exit Loop If [ /* For $i from 1 to $pairCount */ Let ( [ $i = $i + 1 ] ; $i > $pairCount ) and Let ( [ $i = "" ] ; True ) // reset $i at end ]
Step.Calculation: /* For $i from 1 to $pairCount */ Let ( [ $i = $i + 1 ] ; $i > $pairCount ) and Let ( [ $i = "" ] ; True ) // reset $i at end

Step.name: Set Variable
Step.StepText: Set Variable [ $name; Value:/* value names with $ prefixes added randomly */ Let ( [ ~name = $expectedVariable[$i] ]; Choose ( Floor ( Random * 3 ); /* 0, no $ */ Right ( ~name ; Length ( ~name ) - 1 ); /* 1, one $ */ ~name; /* 2, two $ */ "$" & ~name ) ) ]

Value.Calculation: /* value names with $ prefixes added randomly */ Let ( [ ~name = $expectedVariable[$i] ]; Choose ( Floor ( Random * 3 ); /* 0, no $ */ Right ( ~name ; Length ( ~name ) - 1 ); /* 1, one $ */ ~name; /* 2, two $ */ "$" & ~name ) )

DisplayCalculation.Chunk: /* value names with $ prefixes added randomly */

Step.Name: $name

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.StepText: Exit Loop If [ /* $name is not in $nameList */ Position ( $nameList ; ¶ & $name & ¶ ; 1 ; 1 ) = 0 ]

Step.StepText: # ensure that strings of digits separated by certain characters are not misinterpreted as dates
Step.Text: ensure that strings of digits separated by certain characters are not misinterpreted as dates

Step.name: Set Variable
Step.StepText: Set Variable [ $delimiterList; Value:/* characters that FileMaker can misinterpret as date delimiters */ // printable characters "!\"#$%&'()*+,;<=>?@[\]^_`{|}~" // control characters & Char ( 1 ) & Char ( 2 ) & Char ( 3 ) & Char ( 4 ) & Char ( 5 ) & Char ( 6 ) & Char ( 7 ) & Char ( 8 ) & Char ( 14 ) & Char ( 15 ) & Char ( 16 ) & Char ( 17 ) & Char ( 18 ) & Char ( 19 ) & Char ( 20 ) & Char ( 21 ) & Char ( 22 ) & Char ( 23 ) & Char ( 24 ) & Char ( 25 ) & Char ( 26 ) & Char ( 27 ) & Char ( 28 ) & Char ( 29 ) & Char ( 30 ) & Char ( 31 ) & Char ( 127 ) ]

Value.Calculation: /* characters that FileMaker can misinterpret as date delimiters */ // printable characters "!\"#$%&'()*+,;<=>?@[\]^_`{|}~" // control characters & Char ( 1 ) & Char ( 2 ) & Char ( 3 ) & Char ( 4 ) & Char ( 5 ) & Char ( 6 ) & Char ( 7 ) & Char ( 8 ) & Char ( 14 ) & Char ( 15 ) & Char ( 16 ) & Char ( 17 ) & Char ( 18 ) & Char ( 19 ) & Char ( 20 ) & Char ( 21 ) & Char ( 22 ) & Char ( 23 ) & Char ( 24 ) & Char ( 25 ) & Char ( 26 ) & Char ( 27 ) & Char ( 28 ) & Char ( 29 ) & Char ( 30 ) & Char ( 31 ) & Char ( 127 )

DisplayCalculation.Chunk: /* characters that FileMaker can misinterpret as date delimiters */

Step.Calculation: /* For $index from 1 to $valueCount */ Let ( [ $index = $index + 1 ] ; $index > $valueCount and Let ( $index = "" ; True ) // reset $index at end )

Step.name: Set Variable
Step.StepText: Set Variable [ $value; Value:/* random data of selected type */ Choose ( $type ; /* 0, text */ RandomText ( Floor ( RandomUniform ( 0 ; $maxValueLength ) ) ; "" ; "" ) ; /* 1, fixed-point number */ RandomUniform ( -1 ; 1 ) * 10 ^ RandomUniform ( -10 ; 40 ) ; /* 2, floating-point number */ GetAsNumber ( Round ( RandomUniform ( -10 ; 10 ) ; RandomUniform ( 0 ; 19 ) ) & "e" & Round ( RandomUniform ( -400 ; 400 ) ; 0 ) ) ; /* 3, timestamp */ GetAsTimestamp ( Round ( RandomUniform ( $timestampMin ; $timestampMax ) ; Round ( RandomUniform ( -6 ; 6 ) ; 0 ) ) ) ; /* 4, date */ GetAsDate ( Round ( RandomUniform ( $dateMin ; $dateMax ) ; 0 ) ) ; /* 5, time */ GetAsTime ( Round ( RandomUniform ( $timeMin ; $timeMax ) ; Round ( RandomUniform ( -4 ; 6 ) ; 0 ) ) ) ) ]

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.StepText: Exit Loop If [ IsValid ( $value ) and ValueCount ( $value ) ≤ 1 ]

Script.name: Generate Dictionary Sample Data ( maxPairCount ; maxNameLength ; maxValueLength )

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: PURPOSE:

Step.name: Comment
Step.StepText: # Generates random well formed Let notation sample data to use for testing the # data parsing functions.
Step.Text: Generates random well formed Let notation sample data to use for testing the # data parsing functions.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: PARAMETERS:

Step.name: Comment
Step.StepText: # maxPairCount: The number of generated pairs will be between 3 and this number.
Step.Text: maxPairCount: The number of generated pairs will be between 3 and this number.

Step.name: Comment
Step.StepText: # maxNameLength: The length of generated names will be between 1 and this number
Step.Text: maxNameLength: The length of generated names will be between 1 and this number

Step.name: Comment
Step.StepText: # maxValueLength: The length of generated values will be between 0 and this number
Step.Text: maxValueLength: The length of generated values will be between 0 and this number

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: RETURNS:

Step.name: Comment
Step.StepText: # error: The codes of any errors encountered during operation
Step.Text: error: The codes of any errors encountered during operation

Step.name: Comment
Step.StepText: # sourceDictionary: A Let format dictionary string
Step.Text: sourceDictionary: A Let format dictionary string

Step.name: Comment
Step.StepText: # pairCount: The total number of named values included in the non-error subset of sourceDictionary. There may be more actual pairs, as some pairs may be "overwritten" by repeated pairs using the same name.
Step.Text: pairCount: The total number of named values included in the non-error subset of sourceDictionary. There may be more actual pairs, as some pairs may be "overwritten" by repeated pairs using the same name.

Step.name: Comment
Step.StepText: # cleanupDictionary: A Let format dictionary that can be used with the #Assign function to null-out any sample data set to variables by the test.
Step.Text: cleanupDictionary: A Let format dictionary that can be used with the #Assign function to null-out any sample data set to variables by the test.

Step.name: Comment
Step.StepText: # expectedType[N]: The expected resulting data type after using the #Assign function for each name-value pair up to normalPairCount. The first values up to filterPairCount correspond to pairs in the filtered list.
Step.Text: expectedType[N]: The expected resulting data type after using the #Assign function for each name-value pair up to normalPairCount. The first values up to filterPairCount correspond to pairs in the filtered list.

Step.name: Comment
Step.StepText: # expectedVariable[N]: The expected resulting variable name after using the #Assign function for each name-value pair up to normalPairCount. The first values up to filterPairCount correspond to pairs in the filtered list.
Step.Text: expectedVariable[N]: The expected resulting variable name after using the #Assign function for each name-value pair up to normalPairCount. The first values up to filterPairCount correspond to pairs in the filtered list.

Step.name: Comment
Step.StepText: # expectedValue[N]: The expected resulting variable value after using the #Assign function for each name-value pair up to pairCount.
Step.Text: expectedValue[N]: The expected resulting variable value after using the #Assign function for each name-value pair up to pairCount.

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: DEPENDENCIES:

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: Generate Sample Name

Step.name: Comment
Step.StepText: # HISTORY: (open comment to view full history)
Step.Text: HISTORY: (open comment to view full history)

Step.name: Comment
Step.StepText: # Modified on 2013-12-24 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante>. - Stripping newline characters from single-line comments. - Removing dependence on ValueShuffleMerge function, which does not robustly handle values containing newline characters other than the carriage return. Modified on 2013-12-23 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante>. - Randomly insert newline characters in sample values. - Guarantee that sample names do not contain carriage returns. - Expanding character space for names to include spaces (Char ( 32 )). - Randomly insert newline characters (except carriage returns) in names. - Delegate generation of names to a subscript. Modified on 2013-07-10 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> to not use the VerifyVariablesNotEmpty function, which leads to a circular definition problem in the tests of that function. Modified on 2013-05-09 by Daniel Smith dansmith65@gmail.com to fix error that caused $errorPairList to be replaced every time C style commented errors was used. Fix error that caused $expectedType to return incorrect value. Use extremely large values for min/max time, since the time format can store elapsed time, not just 24-hour time. Modified on 2013-01-24 by Daniel Smith dansmith65@gmail.com to only prepend a single "$" to $name when setting $expectedVariable[$i] Modified on 2012-12-17 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> to return expectedType[N]. Modified on 2012-12-17 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> to exclude characters below 33 from test names. Modified on 2012-12-12 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> to generate values of different data types. Modified on 2012-12-07 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> to fix a bug where C-style error comments could be lead to misfomed dictionaries. Modified on 2012-12-04 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> to only use $local variable names for $expectedVariable[n]. Global variables are still included in sourceDictionary. This change reflects the fact that the #Assign function should only be setting values to local variables, even for name-value pairs using global variable names. Created on 2012-12-02 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante>.
Step.Text: Modified on 2013-12-24 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante>. - Stripping newline characters from single-line comments. - Removing dependence on ValueShuffleMerge function, which does not robustly handle values containing newline characters other than the carriage return. Modified on 2013-12-23 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante>. - Randomly insert newline characters in sample values. - Guarantee that sample names do not contain carriage returns. - Expanding character space for names to include spaces (Char ( 32 )). - Randomly insert newline characters (except carriage returns) in names. - Delegate generation of names to a subscript. Modified on 2013-07-10 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> to not use the VerifyVariablesNotEmpty function, which leads to a circular definition problem in the tests of that function. Modified on 2013-05-09 by Daniel Smith dansmith65@gmail.com to fix error that caused $errorPairList to be replaced every time C style commented errors was used. Fix error that caused $expectedType to return incorrect value. Use extremely large values for min/max time, since the time format can store elapsed time, not just 24-hour time. Modified on 2013-01-24 by Daniel Smith dansmith65@gmail.com to only prepend a single "$" to $name when setting $expectedVariable[$i] Modified on 2012-12-17 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> to return expectedType[N]. Modified on 2012-12-17 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> to exclude characters below 33 from test names. Modified on 2012-12-12 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> to generate values of different data types. Modified on 2012-12-07 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> to fix a bug where C-style error comments could be lead to misfomed dictionaries. Modified on 2012-12-04 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante> to only use $local variable names for $expectedVariable[n]. Global variables are still included in sourceDictionary. This change reflects the fact that the #Assign function should only be setting values to local variables, even for name-value pairs using global variable names. Created on 2012-12-02 by Jeremy Bante <http://scr.im/jbante>.

Step.name: If
Step.StepText: If [ not #Assign ( Get ( ScriptParameter ) ) or IsEmpty ( $maxPairCount ) or IsEmpty ( $maxNameLength ) or IsEmpty ( $maxValueLength ) ]
Step.Calculation: not #Assign ( Get ( ScriptParameter ) ) or IsEmpty ( $maxPairCount ) or IsEmpty ( $maxNameLength ) or IsEmpty ( $maxValueLength )

Step.name: Exit Script
Step.StepText: Exit Script [ Result: # ( "error" ; 10 ) // Requested data is missing ]

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: ### Generate name-value pairs

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.StepText: Exit Loop If [ /* For $i from 1 to $normalPairCount */ Let ( [ $i = $i + 1 ] ; $i > $normalPairCount ) and Let ( [ $i = "" ] ; True ) // reset $i at end ]
Step.Calculation: /* For $i from 1 to $normalPairCount */ Let ( [ $i = $i + 1 ] ; $i > $normalPairCount ) and Let ( [ $i = "" ] ; True ) // reset $i at end

Step.name: Perform Script
Step.StepText: Perform Script [ “Generate Sample Name ( maxNameLength )”; Parameter: Get ( ScriptParameter ) ]

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.StepText: Exit Loop If [ /* $name not already used */ Position ( ¶ & $nameList & ¶ ; ¶ & $name & ¶ ; 1 ; 1 ) = 0 ]

Step.name: Set Variable
Step.StepText: Set Variable [ $value; Value:/* random data of selected type */ Choose ( $type ; /* 0, text */ RandomText ( Floor ( RandomUniform ( 0 ; $maxValueLength ) ) ; "" ; "" ) ; /* 1, text containing newline characters */ InsertRandomNewlineCharacter ( RandomText ( Floor ( RandomUniform ( 0 ; $maxValueLength ) ) ; "" ; "" ) ) ; /* 2, fixed-point number */ RandomUniform ( -1 ; 1 ) * 10 ^ RandomUniform ( -10 ; 40 ) ; /* 3, floating-point number */ GetAsNumber ( Round ( RandomUniform ( -10 ; 10 ) ; RandomUniform ( 0 ; 19 ) ) & "e" & Round ( RandomUniform ( -400 ; 400 ) ; 0 ) ) ; /* 4, timestamp */ GetAsTimestamp ( Round ( RandomUniform ( $timestampMin ; $timestampMax ) ; Round ( RandomUniform ( -6 ; 6 ) ; 0 ) ) ) ; /* 5, date */ GetAsDate ( Round ( RandomUniform ( $dateMin ; $dateMax ) ; 0 ) ) ; /* 6, time */ GetAsTime ( Round ( RandomUniform ( $timeMin ; $timeMax ) ; Round ( RandomUniform ( -4 ; 6 ) ; 0 ) ) ) ) ]

Value.Calculation: /* random data of selected type */ Choose ( $type ; /* 0, text */ RandomText ( Floor ( RandomUniform ( 0 ; $maxValueLength ) ) ; "" ; "" ) ; /* 1, text containing newline characters */ InsertRandomNewlineCharacter ( RandomText ( Floor ( RandomUniform ( 0 ; $maxValueLength ) ) ; "" ; "" ) ) ; /* 2, fixed-point number */ RandomUniform ( -1 ; 1 ) * 10 ^ RandomUniform ( -10 ; 40 ) ; /* 3, floating-point number */ GetAsNumber ( Round ( RandomUniform ( -10 ; 10 ) ; RandomUniform ( 0 ; 19 ) ) & "e" & Round ( RandomUniform ( -400 ; 400 ) ; 0 ) ) ; /* 4, timestamp */ GetAsTimestamp ( Round ( RandomUniform ( $timestampMin ; $timestampMax ) ; Round ( RandomUniform ( -6 ; 6 ) ; 0 ) ) ) ; /* 5, date */ GetAsDate ( Round ( RandomUniform ( $dateMin ; $dateMax ) ; 0 ) ) ; /* 6, time */ GetAsTime ( Round ( RandomUniform ( $timeMin ; $timeMax ) ; Round ( RandomUniform ( -4 ; 6 ) ; 0 ) ) ) )

Step.Name: $value

Step.name: Comment
Step.Text: ### Generate comment pairs

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.StepText: Exit Loop If [ /* For $i from 1 to $commentPairCount */ Let ( [ $i = $i + 1 ] ; $i > $commentPairCount ) and Let ( [ $i = "" ] ; True ) // reset $i at end ]
Step.Calculation: /* For $i from 1 to $commentPairCount */ Let ( [ $i = $i + 1 ] ; $i > $commentPairCount ) and Let ( [ $i = "" ] ; True ) // reset $i at end

Step.name: If
Step.StepText: If [ Random < .5 // C++ style commented errors ]

Step.name: Set Variable
Step.StepText: Set Variable [ $commentPair[$i]; Value:"// " & Substitute ( $value ; // strip newline characters [ Char ( 10 ) ; "" ] ; [ ¶ ; "" ] ; [ Char ( 8232 ) ; "" ] ; [ Char ( 8233 ) ; "" ] ) & ¶ ]

Value.Calculation: "// " & Substitute ( $value ; // strip newline characters [ Char ( 10 ) ; "" ] ; [ ¶ ; "" ] ; [ Char ( 8232 ) ; "" ] ; [ Char ( 8233 ) ; "" ] ) & ¶

Step.name: Comment

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.StepText: Exit Loop If [ /* For $i from 1 to $overwriteCount */ Let ( [ $i = $i + 1 ] ; $i > $overwriteCount ) and Let ( [ $i = "" ] ; True ) // reset $i at end ]
Step.Calculation: /* For $i from 1 to $overwriteCount */ Let ( [ $i = $i + 1 ] ; $i > $overwriteCount ) and Let ( [ $i = "" ] ; True ) // reset $i at end

Step.name: Set Variable
Step.StepText: Set Variable [ $value; Value:/* random data of selected type */ Choose ( $type ; /* 0, text */ RandomText ( Floor ( RandomUniform ( 0 ; $maxValueLength ) ) ; "" ; "" ) ; /* 1, text containing newline characters */ InsertRandomNewlineCharacter ( RandomText ( Floor ( RandomUniform ( 0 ; $maxValueLength ) ) ; "" ; "" ) ) ; /* 2, fixed-point number */ RandomUniform ( -1 ; 1 ) * 10 ^ RandomUniform ( -10 ; 40 ) ; /* 3, floating-point number */ GetAsNumber ( Round ( RandomUniform ( -10 ; 10 ) ; RandomUniform ( 0 ; 19 ) ) & "e" & Round ( RandomUniform ( -400 ; 400 ) ; 0 ) ) ; /* 4, timestamp */ GetAsTimestamp ( Round ( RandomUniform ( $timestampMin ; $timestampMax ) ; Round ( RandomUniform ( -6 ; 6 ) ; 0 ) ) ) ; /* 5, date */ GetAsDate ( Round ( RandomUniform ( $dateMin ; $dateMax ) ; 0 ) ) ; /* 6, time */ GetAsTime ( Round ( RandomUniform ( $timeMin ; $timeMax ) ; Round ( RandomUniform ( -4 ; 6 ) ; 0 ) ) ) ) ]

Value.Calculation: /* random data of selected type */ Choose ( $type ; /* 0, text */ RandomText ( Floor ( RandomUniform ( 0 ; $maxValueLength ) ) ; "" ; "" ) ; /* 1, text containing newline characters */ InsertRandomNewlineCharacter ( RandomText ( Floor ( RandomUniform ( 0 ; $maxValueLength ) ) ; "" ; "" ) ) ; /* 2, fixed-point number */ RandomUniform ( -1 ; 1 ) * 10 ^ RandomUniform ( -10 ; 40 ) ; /* 3, floating-point number */ GetAsNumber ( Round ( RandomUniform ( -10 ; 10 ) ; RandomUniform ( 0 ; 19 ) ) & "e" & Round ( RandomUniform ( -400 ; 400 ) ; 0 ) ) ; /* 4, timestamp */ GetAsTimestamp ( Round ( RandomUniform ( $timestampMin ; $timestampMax ) ; Round ( RandomUniform ( -6 ; 6 ) ; 0 ) ) ) ; /* 5, date */ GetAsDate ( Round ( RandomUniform ( $dateMin ; $dateMax ) ; 0 ) ) ; /* 6, time */ GetAsTime ( Round ( RandomUniform ( $timeMin ; $timeMax ) ; Round ( RandomUniform ( -4 ; 6 ) ; 0 ) ) ) )

Step.Text: Randomly mix $pair[N] and $commentPair[N] values, preserving within-list order

Step.name: Set Variable
Step.StepText: Set Variable [ $expectedData; Value:$expectedData & # ( "expectedType[" & $i & "]" ; $expectedType[$i] ) & Let ( [ ~variable = $expectedVariable[$i] ]; # ( "expectedVariable[" & $i & "]" ; If ( Left ( ~variable ; 2 ) = "$$"; // expect local variables only Right ( ~variable ; Length ( ~variable ) - 1 ); /* Else */ ~variable ) ) ) & # ( "expectedValue[" & $i & "]" ; $expectedValue[$i] ) ]

Step.name: If
Step.StepText: If [ not #Assign ( Get ( ScriptParameter ) ) or IsEmpty ( $maxNameLength ) ]

Step.name: Exit Script
Step.StepText: Exit Script [ Result: # ( "error" ; 10 ) // Requested data is missing ]

Step.name: Set Variable
Step.StepText: Set Variable [ $name; Value:Let ( [ ~text = RandomText ( Round ( RandomUniform ( 1 ; $maxNameLength ) ; 0 ) ; 32 ; // names can't contain control characters "" ) ] ; If ( Random > 1 / 3 ; ~text ; /* Else, insert newline character (carriage returns will be weeded out) */ InsertRandomNewlineCharacter ( ~text ) ) ) ]

Value.Calculation: Let ( [ ~text = RandomText ( Round ( RandomUniform ( 1 ; $maxNameLength ) ; 0 ) ; 32 ; // names can't contain control characters "" ) ] ; If ( Random > 1 / 3 ; ~text ; /* Else, insert newline character (carriage returns will be weeded out) */ InsertRandomNewlineCharacter ( ~text ) ) )

DisplayCalculation.Chunk: > 1 / 3 ; ~text ; /* Else, insert newline character (carriage returns will be weeded out) */

Step.Name: $name

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.StepText: Exit Loop If [ /* $name is valid */ Let ( [ ~firstCharacter = Left ( $name ; 1 ) ] ; not IsEmpty ( $name ) and ~firstCharacter ≠ "$" and ~firstCharacter ≠ Char ( 10 ) // creates problems creating return-delimited lists of names and Position ( $name ; "=" ; 1 ; 1 ) = 0 and Position ( $name ; ¶ ; 1 ; 1 ) = 0 and IsValidExpression ( "Let ( $" & $name & " = $" & $name & " ; \"\" )" ) ) ]
Step.Calculation: /* $name is valid */ Let ( [ ~firstCharacter = Left ( $name ; 1 ) ] ; not IsEmpty ( $name ) and ~firstCharacter ≠ "$" and ~firstCharacter ≠ Char ( 10 ) // creates problems creating return-delimited lists of names and Position ( $name ; "=" ; 1 ; 1 ) = 0 and Position ( $name ; ¶ ; 1 ; 1 ) = 0 and IsValidExpression ( "Let ( $" & $name & " = $" & $name & " ; \"\" )" ) )

DisplayCalculation.Chunk: // creates problems creating return-delimited lists of names

Step.Calculation: /* $scriptName does not contain characters used by parameter naming convention */ IsEmpty ( Filter ( $scriptName ; "(){};" ) )

Step.StepText: Exit Loop If [ /* For $i from 1 to $optionalCeiling */ Let ( $i = $i + 1 ; $i > $optionalCeiling ) ]

Step.name: Exit Loop If
Step.StepText: Exit Loop If [ /* $parameter is acceptable */ IsEmpty ( Filter ( $parameter ; "(){};" ) ) // does not contain characters used by script naming convention and Position ( ¶ & $parameterList & ¶ ; ¶ & $parameter & ¶ ; 1 ; 1 ) = 0 // $parameter is not already used and ValueCount ( $parameter ) = 1 ]
Step.Calculation: /* $parameter is acceptable */ IsEmpty ( Filter ( $parameter ; "(){};" ) ) // does not contain characters used by script naming convention and Position ( ¶ & $parameterList & ¶ ; ¶ & $parameter & ¶ ; 1 ; 1 ) = 0 // $parameter is not already used and ValueCount ( $parameter ) = 1

DisplayCalculation.Chunk: // does not contain characters used by script naming convention

Step.name: Set Variable
Step.StepText: Set Variable [ $scriptName; Value:$scriptName & If ( $i = 1; // add opening delimiter If ( Random > .5 ; " " ) // name may or may not include whitespace in delimiters & "(" & If ( Random > .5 ; " " ); /* Else, add delimiter between parameters */ If ( Random > .5 ; " " ) & ";" & If ( Random > .5 ; " " ) ) & $parameter ]

DisplayCalculation.Chunk: // name may or may not include whitespace in delimiters

Step.Name: $scriptName

Step.name: Set Variable
Step.StepText: Set Variable [ $scriptName; Value:$scriptName & If ( $requiredCeiling > 0 and $i = $requiredCeiling + 1; If ( Random > .5 ; " " ) // delimit optional from required parameters & ";" & If ( Random > .5 ; " " ) ) & If ( $i = $requiredCeiling + 1; // add opening delimiter If ( Random > .5 ; " " ) // name may or may not include whitespace in delimiters & "{" & If ( Random > .5 ; " " ); /* Else, add delimiter between parameters */ If ( Random > .5 ; " " ) & ";" & If ( Random > .5 ; " " ) ) & $parameter ]

Value.Calculation: $scriptName & If ( $requiredCeiling > 0 and $i = $requiredCeiling + 1; If ( Random > .5 ; " " ) // delimit optional from required parameters & ";" & If ( Random > .5 ; " " ) ) & If ( $i = $requiredCeiling + 1; // add opening delimiter If ( Random > .5 ; " " ) // name may or may not include whitespace in delimiters & "{" & If ( Random > .5 ; " " ); /* Else, add delimiter between parameters */ If ( Random > .5 ; " " ) & ";" & If ( Random > .5 ; " " ) ) & $parameter

DisplayCalculation.Chunk: // name may or may not include whitespace in delimiters

Step.Name: $scriptName

Step.name: Set Variable
Step.StepText: Set Variable [ $scriptName; Value:/* Add any closing delimiters */ $scriptName & If ( $optionalCeiling > $requiredCeiling; If ( Random > .5 ; " " ) // name may or may not include whitespace in delimiters & "}" & If ( Random > .5 ; " " ) ) & If ( $requiredCeiling > 0; If ( Random > .5 ; " " ) & ")" & If ( Random > .5 ; " " ) ) ]

Value.Calculation: /* Add any closing delimiters */ $scriptName & If ( $optionalCeiling > $requiredCeiling; If ( Random > .5 ; " " ) // name may or may not include whitespace in delimiters & "}" & If ( Random > .5 ; " " ) ) & If ( $requiredCeiling > 0; If ( Random > .5 ; " " ) & ")" & If ( Random > .5 ; " " ) )
